Author: Phineas Kibbey <phineas.kibbey@gmail.com>
Date:   Sat Nov 22 17:23:35 2025 +0000

    Add UI button component and utility functions
    
    Introduces a reusable Button component with multiple variants and sizes using class-variance-authority and Radix UI Slot. Adds a utility function for merging Tailwind and clsx classes. Updates globals.css for new color variables, theme support, and animation imports. Adds required dependencies and configuration for UI components.

days.aiSummary: The day's development for Peak Blooms marks a pivotal transition from monolithic Next.js app setup to a structured, scalable UI framework, showcasing strong engineering foresight in adopting modern components and utility libraries. This commit demonstrates an intentional effort to establish a reusable component architecture while optimizing consistency across design variants through Tailwind CSS and Radix UI principles. The addition of `class-variance-author custom` and `tailwind-merge` highlights a deliberate choice toward maintainable, modular styling solutions rather than hard-coded classes, setting the stage for future growth with scalable components.
keyDecisions: Use of a Next.js component registry (`components.json`) to organize UI components and their configuration early in development, ensuring alignment between design requirements (via `style: 'new-york'`) and branding choices (such as `slate` base color).
Selecting `class-variance-authority` and `tailwind-merge` for dynamic class management—promoting flexibility over static classes while respecting Tailwind's utility-first philosophy.
learnings: The importance of integrating a UI component library early in a project to standardize designs and improve maintainability, even when using a custom design system like `new-york'`.
Tailwind CSS’ variable-based configuration (`tailwind-config.css-variables: true`) can simplify theming and theme switching for large projects, enabling easier future adjustments.

architecturalCallouts.title: Reusable Button Component with Variants
architecturalCallouts.description: Leverage Tailwind's `@authority` mechanism to enable a button component that adapts based on props like `variant' and `size`, promoting consistency across the application.

architecturalCallouts.title: Radix UI Slot for Component Variability
architecturalCallouts.description: Use Radix UI slots (`@radix-ui/react-slot`) to encapsulate internal logic, allowing a single base button component to dynamically render different UI configurations via child components.

architecturalCallouts.title: Class Variance Authority for Tailwind Class Management
architecturalCallouts.description: Use `class-variance-authority` alongside Radix slots to ensure React’s class name reconciliation works harmoniously with dynamic Tailwind utility classes, reducing potential classname collisions.

architecturalCallouts.title: Tailwind CSS Utility Classes with `tailwind-merge'
architecturalCallouts.description: The project is using Tailwind's `tailwind-merge` to prevent class explosion and ensure minimal styling duplication. This is a strong example of utility-first design in combination with dynamic class merging.

architecturalCallouts.title: Optimized Component Loading via RSC (Reconciliation) Configuration
architecturalCallouts.description: This project configures the component registry for `rsc: true` and `tsx: true', enabling Radix UI to be a viable choice without needing heavyweight React classes or CSS-in-JS alternatives. This improves performance while maintaining consistency with Tailwind's style system.

architecturalCallouts.title: Recommended Component Registry Layout
architecturalCallouts.description: The organization of components in `/src/app/[ui]/` and related utilities (e.g., `@/components/ui') is a good approach to scalable component architecture, preventing the monolithic `node_modules' structure while promoting modular imports.

architecturalCallouts.title: Early Dependency Management for UI Components
architecturalCallouts.description: The use of a dedicated `tailwind` config and `slate` base color implies an understanding of modular dependencies, where each component library is imported only when required. This reduces unnecessary bundle size while ensuring all necessary libraries are included.

architecturalCallouts.title: Crafting Dynamic Class Configurations for Tailwind
architecturalCallouts.description: The commit demonstrates an understanding of how class names can be modified dynamically—either by using the `tailwind` config section or by relying on utility classes. This is a key lesson in ensuring flexibility while adhering to tailwind conventions.

architecturalCallouts.title: Radix UI Slots and Geist font integration
architecturalCallouts.description: The combination of Radix UI slots with `next/font` is a clever way to leverage a font-family like Geist for the entire project without duplicating styles across components, emphasizing the use of global styling in Next.js projects.

architecturalCallouts.title: Preventing Hard-Coded CSS in global stylesheets
architecturalCallouts.description: The inclusion of Tailwind variables and animations imports in `globals.css` demonstrates a preference for maintaining consistency via dynamic CSS rather than hard-coded styles, improving future maintainability.
